TopicTitle: How do you expect IVA to change in 1.0 and in further releases?

Articles.Content:
Simple enough question on an interesting enough topic.

Personally, I would want to see further ability to explore the interior of spacecrafts, though this might indeed put a considerable strain on some player's rigs. It would also be incredibly neat to be able to interact with switches and buttons on control panels. Furthermore, IVAs would be incredible if you could do so on EVA (an IVA-EVA. LOL ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)), and especially on the surface. 

What would you guys think to be good things to speculate on with regards to IVA?
Since frizzank is doing IVA, I demand a cornbeef sandwich in each IVA he makes.

Nothing will change in regards to interacting with IVA, IMO. We can certainly hope for more props and information but I wouldn't hold my breath. Otherwise frizzank will likely do an excellent job with the remaining IVAs, which will then be picked up by the community and RPM'd.
I hope that they make an overhaul of existing IVA also
I hope it's possible to take a vessel to orbit only sitting in the pod which means more info display and more interactive buttons
A stage ignitor would be great.

Yeah I don't imagine it will change radically for 1.0, but maybe 1.1 or 1.2 could delve more deeply into kerbal life, finishing the Skills and Experience system, creating randomized kerbal appearance for new recruits, further development on making science experiments fun, maybe life support and making IVA more interesting. A little bit ago I suggested a cut-away view that would let you easily see and move resources about a vessel and also let you move kerbals from one module to another without EVA. It would also be cool if as part of an experiments overhaul you could do more things from inside the science module, like loading materials into the materials bay, processing experiment results, managing data more clearly, etc.
